Post Study Treatment Discontinuation Anti-cancer Procedures and Treatment

footnotes.text: If screening assessments completed within 14 days they do not need to be repeated on Day 1 if patient's condition has not changed
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional logic (if within 14 days) AND affects scheduling (may skip assessments). Both EDC branching and scheduling are affected.

footnotes.text: Treatment discontinuation visit to be performed only for the patients who prematurely discontinued treatment. For the patient who completed 3 years treatment (156 weeks), the last visit (Week 156) in treatment period will be considered as treatment discontinuation.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Specifies condition for visit occurrence (only for premature discontinuation) which creates conditional branch logic in EDC.

footnotes.text: As a minimum, telephone contact should be made with the patient 28 days (+7 days) following discontinuation of study drug
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Specifies timing window (28 +7 days) for follow-up contact, affecting visit scheduling.

footnotes.text: Follow-up until disease recurrence visits to performed for the patients who discontinue/completed treatment before disease recurrence
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional logic for visit occurrence based on treatment status and disease recurrence, affecting EDC branching.

footnotes.text: Consent may be taken any time prior to 28 days window; Screening Part II period will start with first study-related assessment
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Describes consent timing procedure without creating conditional logic or affecting visit scheduling - purely operational guidance for sites.

footnotes.text: Mandatory: sufficient quantity for central confirmation of EGFR mutation status, retrospective T790M testing and for exploratory analyses
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Describes specimen handling requirements without creating conditions or affecting scheduling - purely operational for sample processing.

footnotes.text: Optional: tumour sample at disease recurrence
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Specifies optional condition for specimen collection at disease recurrence, creating conditional branch logic in EDC.

footnotes.text: Assessments to be completed pre-dose on the visit day
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Specifies timing constraint (pre-dose) for assessments within visit, affecting scheduling of activities.

footnotes.text: All ECG data (with the exception of screening ECGs) will be collected digitally for the first year, standard ECGs will be performed thereafter; ECG is also to be performed in event of a cardiac AE
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Multi-label: Contains both conditional logic (if cardiac AE occurs) AND operational procedures for ECG collection methods.

footnotes.text: MRI or contrast CT of brain must be done before randomisation if not performed prior to surgery. MRI/contrast CT scans of the brain must also be conducted at recurrence.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional logic based on prior events (if not done before surgery, if recurrence occurs) affecting EDC branching.

footnotes.text: In the rare case where a patient is intolerant of the contrast medium, the preferred imaging would be CT chest without contrast and MRI abdomen with contrast however non contrast abdominal CT will also be accepted. All recurrences on study need to be confirmed with imaging of the chest and abdomen (including liver and adrenal glands). The imaging method used at baseline (CT or MRI) must be used at each subsequent follow-up assessment. MRI/contrast CT scans of the brain must be conducted at recurrence.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional branches for imaging alternatives based on contrast intolerance and recurrence events, affecting EDC logic.

footnotes.text: Baseline scans within 28 days of first dose
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Specifies timing window (within 28 days) for baseline scans, affecting visit scheduling.

footnotes.text: Required only if suspicious signs/symptoms are not covered by CT of chest and abdomen (including liver and adrenal glands) at baseline and follow-up
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional logic for imaging based on clinical signs/symptoms not covered by standard imaging, affecting EDC branching.

footnotes.text: If for any reason a sample is not drawn prior to dosing, it may be taken at any visit until the last study visit
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional logic for alternative sampling timing if initial sample not collected, affecting EDC branching.

footnotes.text: Plasma samples 10ml prior to first randomised dose on Day 1; 20-30 ml at every 12 weeks visits. If patient discontinues study treatment prior to disease recurrence, samples should continue to be collected in accordance with the scan schedule until disease recurrence is noted.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Multi-label: Contains specimen handling procedures AND conditional logic for continued collection after discontinuation.

footnotes.text: Blood sampling at 4 weeks, 24 weeks, 48 weeks, 96 weeks after randomisation. Blood draw to occur 3 times at each visit at following time points: pre-dose, between 0,5-1,5h post dose, between 2-4 h post dose. 96 week PK sample post IDMC7 analysis will not be collected.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Multi-label: Specifies detailed timing schedules for PK sampling AND conditional logic for 96-week sample collection based on IDMC analysis.

footnotes.text: SF 36 at 12 weeks, 24 weeks and then every 24 weeks relative to randomisation (± 7 days) until disease recurrence
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Specifies detailed frequency and timing schedule for SF-36 questionnaire collection, affecting visit scheduling.

footnotes.text: Patients will be asked about any health resource use between visits (i.e., excluding routine follow-up clinic visits associated with the clinical trial but including both planned and unplanned admissions) at every scheduled visit during the study.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Describes operational procedure for health resource data collection without creating conditions or affecting scheduling - purely informational guidance.

footnotes.text: AEs ongoing at treatment discontinuation to be followed through to resolution; thereafter, only SAEs/concomitant medications for SAEs considered related to IP and study procedures to be recorded in eCRF
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Creates conditional logic for AE follow-up based on treatment discontinuation and event resolution status, affecting EDC branching.

footnotes.text: Investigator assessment of response/progression to be collected
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Describes operational requirement for investigator assessment collection without creating conditions or affecting scheduling.

footnotes.text: To establish survival status patient will be contacted in the week following date of DCO for IDMC and in the two weeks following date of DCO for primary analysis and subsequent analyses.
footnotes.classificationReasoning: Specifies specific timing constraints for survival status contact relative to DCO dates, affecting scheduling.
